An audio codec is the software that compresses and decompressed a digital audio signal.
Sample rate is the number of samples of audio carried per second, measured in Hz or kHz.
Bitrate refers to the number of bits, or the amount of data, that are processed over a certain amount of time. In audio, this usually means kilobits per second.
The format that your recording will be outputted in, e.g. MP4, 3GPP, etc.
